meanings.definition: To behave in a manner characteristic of a womaniser.
meanings.sent1: He womanised by flirting with every woman he met.
meanings.sent2: She womanised by constantly seeking attention from women.
meanings.sent3: His friends teased him for womanising at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her behavior womanised the idea of charm and charisma.
meanings.sent5: The movie character womanised his way through social gatherings.

meanings.sent1: They womanised by going to bars every night.
meanings.sent2: The celebrity was known for womanising with different partners.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends womanised together during their vacation.
meanings.sent4: Her actions womanised the concept of casual relationships.
meanings.sent5: The novel's protagonist womanised without considering the consequences.

meanings.sent1: She womanised at the party last night.
meanings.sent2: He womanised during his college years.
meanings.sent3: The cat womanised around the house all day.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph womanised memories of youth.
meanings.sent5: The garden womanised with colorful flowers after the rain.
